ru.jango.j0loader

Class Request

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.jango.j0loader.Request

  • public class Request
extends java.lang.Object
    Class-container for information, needed for loaders to work:
    • URI of the request destination
    • List<Param> with request parameters (for HTTP POST and GET)
    • HTTP method - basically it is determined automatically, GET is in priority
    • size of the response data in bytes (value of HTTP response 'content-length' header, file size, etc.; -1 if the data size is unknown or unavailable)

        Constructs new request with some internal variables. HTTP method will be set automatically.
        Parameters:

        responseContentLength - response "content-length" header value, file size, etc.
        See Also:

      • Request

        public Request(java.net.URI uri,
       long responseContentLength,
       java.util.List<Param> params)
        Constructs new request with all internal variables. HTTP method will be set automatically.
        Parameters:
        uri - request destination
        responseContentLength - response "content-length" header value, file size, etc.
        params - list of HTTP parameters to send with request
        See Also:
        getComposedURI(), getRecommendedMethod()

    • Method Detail

      • setResponseContentLength

        public void setResponseContentLength(long responseContentLength)

      • getResponseContentLength

        public long getResponseContentLength()

      • setRequestParams

        public void setRequestParams(java.util.List<Param> params)
        Sets HTTP parameters for this request. This method also determines optimal HTTP method and applies it. That is - rewrites previously set HTTP method.
        See Also:
        getRecommendedMethod()

      • getRequestParams

        public java.util.List<Param> getRequestParams()

      • setMethod

        public void setMethod(Request.Method method)
               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Manually sets the HTTP method for sending request. Basically this is unnecessary because Request automatically determines optimal method when setting params list.
        Parameters:
        method - desired Request.Method for sending HTTP request
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if parameters, specified previously, couldn't be sent by passed into setMethod method
        See Also:
        getRecommendedMethod(), setRequestParams(java.util.List)

      • getMethod

        public Request.Method getMethod()

      • canComposeParams

        protected boolean canComposeParams()
        Checks if params list could be composed in a single URI for sending via HTTP GET.

      • getComposedParams

        protected java.lang.String getComposedParams()
        Composes params list string witch could be appended to the request URI for HTTP GET usage.
        Returns:
        string, composed from params list, or NULL, if it is impossible - than only HTTP POST could be used

      • getComposedURI

        public java.net.URI getComposedURI()
        Composes params list string and appends it to the request URI for HTTP GET usage. Always returns new URI instance.
        Returns:
        if HTTP GET could be used - returns ready to use URI (initial one with appended params), else returns copy of the initial URI as a new instance (params the should be send using HTTP POST)

      • getComposedURL

        public java.net.URL getComposedURL()
                            throws java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                   java.net.MalformedURLException
        Same as getComposedURI() but already transformed into URL.
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException
        java.net.MalformedURLException

      • getRecommendedMethod

        public Request.Method getRecommendedMethod()
        Looks through request params list and returns desired method for sending them. HTTP GET is in priority, so if it could be used, then Request.Method.GET will be returned.

        HTTP GET could be used if:
        • params were not set at all
        • params list contains only StringParams
        • final uri-string composed by initial URI and all params is not longer the 255 chars - limitation of URI standards and HTTP protocol itself


        This method is used in all Request constructors, setMethod(ru.jango.j0loader.Request.Method) and setRequestParams(java.util.List).

      • getURI

        public java.net.URI getURI()

        public java.net.URL getURL()

                           java.net.MalformedURLException
